answerText: The Open Society and Its Enemies[10] The Open Society and Its Enemies was written by this philosopher, who also wrote The Poverty of Historicism. As a philosopher of science, he supported falsifiability as a scientific criterion.
heading: Michigan Fall Tournament |2013 | Editors Round 11 | 9 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The second section of this book, "The High Tide of Prophecy," blames Hegel and Marx for the rise of 20th-century totalitarianism. For 10 points each: [10] Name this 1945 book which criticizes historicist political philosophy.
